title: Digital Video Essentials: HD Basics [Blu-ray] (2008)
description:
Digital Video Essentials: HD Basics [Blu-ray] (2008)
 <a href="
http://www.videoessentials.com/DVE_HDBasics.php" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.videoessentials.com/DVE_HDBasics.php</a>


Created by home theater industry legend Joe Kane, HD Basics is the
definitive High Definition home theater calibration tool. It promises to
improve your picture and give you an understanding of the concepts that
are vital to getting the most out of your HDTV.

Easy to use menu system
25 minute 'quick set-up" option including an in depth description and explanation of how to use specific test patterns to calibrate your display
Audio calibration test signals
Descriptive text in the menu to help navigate each option
A 90 minute overview of the basics of HDTV
Introduction to the world of creating HDTV programs
Audio commentary by Cinematographer Allen Daviau and Joe Kane.

CNET: 
The good: Extensive test patterns, lots of tutorials.
The bad: Not as easy to navigate or understand as the Disney disc.
The bottom line: There's a lot here to keep the average TV enthusiast busy for hours. Tutorials and test patterns will ensure everything is set up correctly. 
It's not as user-friendly or as slick as Disney's WOW, and real beginners could get overwhelmed. That said, its got just about everything most people would need.

 <a href="
http://howto.cnet.com/8301-11310_39-20060847-285/reviewed-blu-ray-setup-discs-for-your-hdtv/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://howto.cnet.com/8301-11310_39-20060847-285/reviewed-blu-ray-setup-discs-for-your-hdtv/</a>

You will need a blue color filter if your TV doesn't have a blue only mode. Most probably it doesn't.

Enjoy!
